tasks.task: Conduct an educational talk on insect management for commercial strawberry production.
subtasks: Present an overview of strawberries' season at a glance, highlighting key pest occurrences.
Discuss cutworm and aphid management for early planting stages.
Address spider mites, thrips, and strawberry clippers' management during winter and early spring.
Outline strategies for controlling beetles, slugs, snails, and spotted wing drosophila during harvest.
Explain two spotted spider mite biology and monitoring techniques.
Describe sap beetle feeding habits and cultural control methods.
Detail chili thrips impacts and integrated pest management options.
Elaborate on spotted wing drosophila life cycle and damage assessment.
Recommend chemical and biological control methods for spotted wing drosophila.
Discuss behavioral controls and attract-and-kill strategies for spotted wing drosophila.
Highlight the importance of pollinator health and habitat in strawberry production.
Distribute resources such as the Southeast Small Fruit Consortium Guide and IPM app for ongoing management.
Acknowledge contributors and address audience questions about strawberry pest management.
Keep pesticide applications during harvest minimal and consider non-target effects on beneficial insects.
